newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine to issue T-bills on December 6.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine to issue T-bills on December 6.

text.p: Ukraine's central bank will auction three-month, six-month, nine-month and 12-month discount treasury bills on December 6, a central bank official said on Thursday.

The volume of three-month T-bills was set at 10 million hryvnias, but the bank is not setting an issue volume for the remaining paper, the head of the bank's market and exchange department, Vitaly Migashko, told Reuters.
At the last three-month T-bill sale on November 26, the bank sold 29.389 million hryvnias of paper, with an average annualised yield of 55.99 percent. The average price was 87.75 hryvnias.
The bank sold 42.290 million hryvnias in six-month T-bills on November 28, with an average annualised yield of 59.90 percent and an average price of 77.00 hryvnias.
Nine-month discount T-bills sold at an average price of 69.55 hryvnias on November 28 at an auction of 88.357 million hryvnias of paper with average yields of 58.54 percent.
The bank sold 89,300 hryvnias of 12-month discount T-bills on November 28, with an average annualised yield of 61.20 percent and an average price of 61.10 hryvnias.
